name: El Salvador
takeaway: The PRC’s role in El Salvador during 2023 is closely linked to the personal interests of President Nayib Bukele's administration, with President Bukele himself being a central figure.

El Salvador's relationship with China is based on a $500 million non-reimburseable cooperation agreement signed in 2019, yet the details of this agreement lack transparency. There is no formal strategic partnership or official declaration to this effect. The agreements President Bukele signed in 2019 are primarily focused on cooperative projects, predominantly in infrastructure.

Under President Bukele's leadership, China has been portrayed positively as a significant benefactor aiding El Salvador in modernizing various sectors, such as libraries, beaches, and ports, seemingly without expecting anything in return.
description-1: In 2023, El-Salvador had a GDP per capita of US$5,344 and a total population of 6.30 million people.
description-2: El-Salvador established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 2018. El-Salvador was ranked 133rd in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 53/100.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: The Salvadoran Government has three state media: Radio El Salvador, Noticiero El Salvador (channel 10) and Diario El Salvador where information about Chinese cooperation in El Salvador is highlighted when necessary. For example, the inauguration of a library built with funds from China. However, there is no evidence that they are part of the World Chinese Media network.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.note:
While there is no evidence that there are journalists who are part of this network, journalists who work for Diario El Salvador newspaper, Radio El Salvador or Noticiero El Salvador (TV channel 10) are periodically invited as part of tours that China organizes for Latin American journalists. 

Diario El Salvador newspaper is a semiprivate print media with government funds and Radio El Salvador and Noticiero El Salvador (TV channel 10 National Broadcast) belong to Salvadoran government. The following report is a result of one those trips: https://diarioelsalvador.com/yunnan-el-paraiso-de-china/432922/
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: While these types of trips for media have been known to occur in the past, there is no evidence of this type of trip since January of 2022.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "No" rating.
Media.note: The first trip for journalists was organized in 2018, a year before Nayib Bukele became president. China invited journalists from state media and private media. But after Bukele became President they began to restrict the origin of the journalists. This is the last public record about this kind of trip: https://www.facebook.com/GobiernoSV/videos/186763238884810/
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: The only media that publishes critical information against China's presence in El Salvador is Expediente Público. The most visible problem so far is that the author of the publications is not invited to official events organized by China embassy and the information officer of the Government of El Salvador does not accept his calls.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence:
Nayib Bukele's Government has an official newspaper called Diario El Salvador, which is in charge of publishing all works.

Diario El Salvador organizes special publications on China's cooperation with the Bukele Government and its journalists are the only ones who have access to the works they are carrying out. For instance: ""The embassy of the People's Republic of China in El Salvador reiterated that both nations are making progress in strengthening their ties of friendship through non-reimbursable cooperation (grant), after laying the first stone for the construction of the National Stadium of El Salvador"", was published in edition from December 2, 2023.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Although there is no parliamentary group that expresses a particular relationship with China, the FMLN leftist political party defends good relations with China, while the president of Congress, Ernesto Castro, who belongs to Nuevas Ideas party, has held various official meetings with Chinese ambassadors in the legislative office.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence:
In December 2019, President Nayib Bukele and Xi Jinping signed a series of agreements in which China pledged El Salvador $500 million in development projects, including a sports stadium and a new $40 million national library in San Salvador, a new tourist pier in La Libertad, $85 million to improve water treatment facilities in La Libertad and Ilopango, and $200 million to support “Surf City” project, which seeks to transform El Salvador's Pacific coast into a beach vacation destination. Additionally, there have been donations to the country for emergency responses, education, and culture. Therefore, this indicator deserves a ""more than a few"" rating.

The size of this agreement is considerable for a country with an economy the size of El Salvador. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
Foreign Policy.note: For a full list of projects over the last several years, you can visit: https://public.tableau.com/app/profile/ep2ea/viz/CHNA-CA_EA/Dashboard42
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Foreign Policy.evidence: El Salvador's ambassador to China, Aldo Alvarez, said in August 2023 that one of the things that was agreed upon is precisely, on the part of El Salvador, the acceptance and recognition of the one-China principle, and we continue to do so. We consider that it is the correct and appropriate path in the international plan. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.

Academia.evidence: Huawei El Salvador organized a contest in which students from different universities managed to be included in the Seeds for the Future program. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "more than a few" rating. The prize was a two-week stay with the Chinese company that will train them on new technologies. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: There is one Confucius Institute in El Salvador. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "few" rating. The Confucius Institute is located at an important National University (Universidad de El Salvador) where they offer programs for learning Mandarin. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Academia.evidence: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs reports on scholarship programs at Chinese universities as part of the international cooperation offer, while scholarships are also provided through the Confucius Center in the country. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "few" rating. There is no other institution authorized to provide official information on higher studies in Chinese universities. Therefore this indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
Academia.note:
48 Salvadoran students traveled to China to continue their university studies and strengthen the cultural-educational exchange with El Salvador.
https://spanish.news.cn/20230828/1cc44c30107d4415811bf0ec6997d305/c.html

Domestic Politics.evidence: In 2019, San Salvador, signed a sister-city agreement with Hangzhou province. Therefore this indicator merits a "few" rating. Since San Salvador is the capital of the country, the indicator merits a "significant" rating.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon during the current reporting period.
Domestic Politics.note:
China invited members of parliament from different parties to visit the country on an official tour in 2019. After that tour, there have been no new invitations. Since Mr. Bukele became President, the Chinese embassy prioritizes its communication with direct intermediaries, such as the president of Congress, Ernesto Castro, and the president's brother, Karim Bukele, whose role is more opaque. El Salvador's current ambassador in Beijing plays an intermediary role while the president of the Legislative Assembly usually meets with the PRC diplomat on duty. 

https://www.laprensagrafica.com/elsalvador/Dos-misiones-de-diputados-viajaran-a-China-Popular-este-mes-20190401-0475.html
https://twitter.com/EmbajadaChinaSV/status/1453491479847051265 
https://diarioelsalvador.com/nuevo-embajador-de-china-en-el-salvador-se-reunio-con-presidente-de-asamblea-legislativa/326407/

Domestic Politics.evidence: The public position regarding China's influence in El Salvador is neutral among political, academic and economic sectors. Even the lack of depth about the Chinese presence simplifies the perception that citizens in general have  and which is predominantly positive.
Domestic Politics.note:
The president of the Salvadoran Legislative Assembly, Ernesto Castro, met virtually with his Chinese counterpart, Li Zhanshu, on January 19, 2022, with whom he spoke about ""cooperation and the prospects for joint work."" 

Castro is the visible face of public rapprochements with China, while behind the scenes it is heard that President Bukele's older brother, Karim Bukele, is in charge of the diplomatic level. However, there is no public record of Mr. Karim Bukele's trips to China in 2023.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Economy.evidence:
The United States was the main trading partner with El Salvador in 2022. In that year, the trade value of El Salvador with the United States reached almost 7.9 billion U.S. dollars, out of which 2.79 billion dollars accounted for exports. The second most important trading partner for this Central American country was Guatemala, reaching a trade value of roughly 2.9 billion U.S. dollars.
While El Salvador's leading exported goods were knitted apparel items, the country's main imported products included petroleum oils and oils obtained from bituminous minerals.
Economy.note: China officially carries out works in El Salvador within the framework of a cooperation agreement for $500 million. The main trading partner of El Salvador is still USA so far. For example, in 2021 USA was the first place of ten countries to which El Salvador sells the most. China was the number ten.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Military.evidence: A definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided. Under Bukele's administration, the National Army bought Israeli weapons and Mexican equipment, but not from the PRC.
Military.note: However, in a circumstantial conversation with a mid-ranking Salvadoran military officer, he said that the Ministry of Defense of El Salvador "was thinking about pricing assault rifles to modernize army personnel." But there is no official information that confirms that possibility because El Salvador generally acquires equipment mainly from the United States.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.
